alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 2:35PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Mainland Monroe County through 300 PM EDT... At 235 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Loop Road Ee Center, or 21 miles southeast of Chokoloskee, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Loop Road Ee Center and Everglades National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
